#summary django-jqmobile Installation documentation

= Introduction =

Here you will find the basic configurations required to get you started.

== Requirements ==

django-jqmobile requires [django-mobileadmin](https://github.com/jezdez/django-mobileadmin/). Unfortunately I had to fork the project in a temporary branch so I could apply patches to fix bugs or add features. You can use svn to get it:

{{{

svn co http://django-jqmobile.googlecode.com/svn/branches/sandbox/contrib/mobileadmin mobileadmin

}}}

When the code base of django-jqmobile will stabilize I will try to push my patches to django-mobileadmin

== Configurations ==

=== settings.py ===

{{{

STATICFILES_DIRS = (
    # ...
    '/full/path/to/jqmobile/static/',
)

TEMPLATE_DIRS = (
    # ...
    '/full/path/to/jqmobile/templates/',
)

INSTALLED_APPS = (
    # ...
    'mobileadmin',
    'jqmobile',
)

# Tell mobiladmin to use jQuery.mobile for all
# mobile traffic (or use your custom filter)
MOBILEADMIN_USER_AGENTS = {
    'mobile_jquery': r'.*',
}

}}}

=== urls.py ===

{{{

from django.conf.urls.defaults import *

from django.contrib import admin
import mobileadmin

admin.autodiscover()
mobileadmin.autoregister()


urlpatterns = patterns('',
    (r'^admin/', include(admin.site.urls)),
    (r'^ma/', include(mobileadmin.sites.site.urls)),
)

handler404 = 'mobileadmin.views.page_not_found'
handler500 = 'mobileadmin.views.server_error'

}}}
